body_html: Thanks for the heads up. So much for targeting all devices I might go down a different road for my apps. Simon Beaumont On 9 Nov 2017, at 21:11, Mike Burrows <notifications@github.com> wrote: On the XLA issues, you should configure without XLA on MacOS. I suspect that XLA won't have support on MacOS for a while yet. (That is, the people who support XLA might accept fixes, but I doubt they'll be working on MacOS themselves for a while.) On the tensorboard issue, you've probably reported that in its own project. I'm going to close this issue, since the nsync-related issues reported originally seem to be resolved. — You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body_text:
Thanks for the heads up. So much for targeting all devices I might go down a different road for my apps.

Simon Beaumont

On 9 Nov 2017, at 21:11, Mike Burrows <notifications@github.com> wrote:

On the XLA issues, you should configure without XLA on MacOS.
I suspect that XLA won't have support on MacOS for a while yet.
(That is, the people who support XLA might accept fixes, but I doubt they'll be
working on MacOS themselves for a while.)

On the tensorboard issue, you've probably reported that in its own project.

I'm going to close this issue, since the nsync-related issues reported originally
seem to be resolved.

—
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body:
Thanks for the heads up. So much for targeting all devices I might go down a different road for my apps.

Simon Beaumont

On 9 Nov 2017, at 21:11, Mike Burrows <notifications@github.com> wrote:

On the XLA issues, you should configure without XLA on MacOS.
I suspect that XLA won't have support on MacOS for a while yet.
(That is, the people who support XLA might accept fixes, but I doubt they'll be
working on MacOS themselves for a while.)

On the tensorboard issue, you've probably reported that in its own project.

I'm going to close this issue, since the nsync-related issues reported originally
seem to be resolved.

—
